Detailed Description

Specific implementation of the Gripper class, with the assumtpion that the Gripper is controlled by two digital lines. The Gripper functions open() and close() control the Gripper through the two digital lines. The digital channels can be specified in the global configuration file.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: End Effector Classes 
// Authors:   Vijayakrishna Basettihalli
// Start Date: Fri Jun 08 06:12:46 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: DefaultGripper.t.cpp
// Example program for the class DefaultGripper.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <conio.h>


// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "DefaultGripper.hpp"

//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  DefaultGripper gripper;

  if (gripper.d_objectStatus.isStatusError()) 
  {
    cout << gripper.d_objectStatus.getMessageText() << endl;
    return -1;
  }
  
  cout << "Menu: " << endl;
  cout << " \t[o]pen" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[c]lose" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[q]uit" <<endl;
  char ch;
  
  while ((ch=getch()) != 'q') 
  {
    if (ch=='o')
      gripper.open();
    else
      if (ch=='c')
        gripper.close();
  }
    
  RoboticPlatform::exit();            
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DefaultGripper ( const char * objectName )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the object name. If the section in the global configuration file specified by the object name has the class name "DefaultGripper", then the settings of this section are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, identical with the section name in the global configuration file.

DefaultGripper ( int numInConfig = 1 )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the number of the object in the global configuration file that specifies the class name "DefaultGripper". The settings of this object in the global configuration are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
numInConfig   Number of the object in the global configuration file (only objects of the correct class type are counted), starting at "1".

DefaultGripper ( const TypeInfo * parent ) [protected]
 

The constructor initializes class variables. This constructor is only called from a derived class.

~DefaultGripper ( ) [virtual]
 

Destructor.

bool isOpen ( ) [virtual]
 

Determines if the gripper is open.

Returns:
true: If the gripper is open.
false: If the gripper is closed.

Reimplemented from Gripper.

void relax ( ) [virtual]
 

Relaxes the gripper ( Does not apply any force to the gripper).

Reimplemented from Gripper.

void create3DModel ( )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Registers the nodes in the gripper VRML file for simulation.

void setSimulationModeOn ( )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject.

Parameters:
Sets   simulation mode on and switches off hardware control.

void setSimulationModeOff ( )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Sets simulation mode off and starts hardware control. Connects to an I/O board server (specified in the global configuration file entry "ioBoardServerName", or "qrts/iobs0" by default). This function might fail if the connection to the I/O board fails. In that case, d_objectStatus is set to "Error" and the object enters simulation mode.

void readGlobalConfiguration ( Config * config )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Reads in entries for digital channels to control the Gripper, control values and name of I/O server to connect to.

void outputInfo ( ostream & stream = cout ) [virtual]
 

Outputs information about the object to an output stream. This class adds hardware specific information of the manipulator such as the IOBoardServerName, channels for arm power bit, etc.

Parameters:
stream   Stream to output the information to.

Member Data Documentation

TypeInfoT< DefaultGripper > s_typeInfo [static]
 

The static type info object of the class. Every class derived from RoboticObject must have this static data member and initialize it correctly.

Reimplemented from Gripper.
